Bought this app specifically to show relatives our photos and videos on our Android TV. All of our Dropbox photos (camera uploads) come from an iPhone. Dropbox and the Dropbox App plays the videos the right way up, yet when they come through dFolio they're all upside down!! Fantastic quality but completely unwatchable. So for that reason 2 stars and not 5. Please can this be addressed as it's currently not fit for purpose. Thanks
replyContent: Can you write me at snapwoodapps@gmail.com so I can learn more about your situation?  Thanks!

content: Really a great app and does exactly what you need. Response time for any issues you might have is super speedy and very helpful as well! Definitely a hidden gem when it comes to useful and easy apps

I've more than 4200 photos I recently uploaded to Dropbox, DELETING THEM to save space. FIRST, I created the DB Folders, WITH THE EXACT SAME NAMES OF THE FOLDERS IN MY GALLERIES. Thrilled to find THIS app, to view & download the photos I WANT BACK in my Galleries. BUT Dfolio told me these Folders WERE EMPTY, even after I repeatedly tapped REFRESH. **What DID display in THIS IMAGE VIEWING APP? A Folder holding my backed up APK's! Huh?? To install?? No refund. EXCLUSIVELY USE ONLY RELIABLE DROPBOX!
replyContent: Please email me at snapwood@snapwoodapps.com for support or a refund.  The app shows all of your folders but only supported images.  If your images are jpgs, they should be in the app.  Please email so I can help resolve this matter.  Thanks!

replyContent: Please try the latest v2.4.4 update, which should be better.  You will have to do a delete downloads or clear data to reset the download.  If it is not better, please email me at snapwood@snapwoodapps.com so we can converse further.  The source image will have some role to play in its rendered quality, which is less of an impact with Flickr.

Interface and connectivity are good. Unfortunately, while the app is downloading a photo, the screen goes black, saying "downloading" esp. for large photos. It should instead keep on showing the previous photo. Starting with a large collection, you have to look at a lot of black until everything is downloaded. Also, showing from multiple subfolders is broken, causing the slideshow to hang on Nexus 10 (must force kill).   Response to developer: I never contacted you by email. You are confused.
replyContent: Once the app is allowed to auto download, you will no longer see the "downloading" message for photos that are not locally cached.  Reviews are not an area for support.  If you truly want help, please contact snapwood@snapwoodapps.com so that can happen.

When I turned on Dropbox's native auto-upload, I was frustrated to see that it changed the file names as they were uploaded! I wanted something that would just copy the raw photos, without modification, into my Dropbox so that I could then manage them on my Desktop machine easily. dbFolio does exactly that, and it gives me lots of ways to manage when it does its uploading.   In general, I'm very happy with all of the *Folio products from Snapwood. For example, PicFolio is a much better uploader than the native Android Picasa Uploader because it is much more robust to network failures, and I have lots of batch editing options. Great products from Snapwood. Well worth the $2.50 to $3 per app.

There is a glitch when you have multi accounts it does not refresh.  So account (A) has 20 pics when you switch to account (B) it says 20 pics also though there are many more.  You open account (B) and it shows account (A) pics.  A refresh avoids this and to me nothing but should be fixed
AWESOME APP FOR TRUE VICTORIOUS PHOTO COLLECTORS:-):-):-)

This app is a great way to display your dropbox photos on your tablet/phone. The original Dropbox app isn't bad but you (currently) have to manually choose which photos you want to save locally for offline access. This app can be set up to always open at the "photos" folder or root folder. I have it set up to go directly to the Photo folder and download everything in that folder (automatically only on wifi while charging). The slideshow view in this app is cleaner as you can hide any overlay (image title, share/delete icons etc) from appearing accidentally (via single/double tap) as it would with the official app.  That overlay is useful for myself to perform actions but I don't want it to be visible while I show off my images.  This clean simple interface solves that "you're doing it wrong" frustration when you hand your tablet to someone else to see a photo album.  I have used the Flickr version of this app too which is virtually identical and just as useful.
Doesn't auto download mp4 videos,  that would make it perfect.
Provides the features that are missing from the Dropbox app.

Does what I needed it for. Haven't tried the auto upload feature because allshareplay does that already. but it's a nice simple gallery for dropbox. Saves a lot of storage space keeping photos on dropbox.

The app is well made and performs quickly. However I am still poking around to see if the feature I bought it for is available. Auto refreshing during slideshow. I would greatly appreciate insight if available. Thanks.
